item.title: Outgoing Burundi President Nkurunziza dies
item.description: Burundi President Pierre Nkurunziza, a fitness enthusiast who increasingly relied on religion and repression to rule the impoverished and unstable central African nation for 15 years, has died.

item.title: George Floyd’s funeral begins in Houston
item.description: Mourners dressed in black, some of them wearing "I can't breathe" shirts, have gathered at a church in Houston, Texas, for George Floyd's funeral.

item.title: HK protesters mark march anniversary
item.description: Hundreds of protesters have gathered in central Hong Kong to mark a year of sustained pro-democracy rallies as fears over looming national security legislation have reignited unrest in the global financial hub.

item.title: US may have photos of MH17 missile: court
item.description: The United States may have crucial satellite photos of the missile used to bring down MH17 six years ago but the images are classified, a court has heard.

item.title: Moscow lockdown ends despite virus cases
item.description: Residents of Moscow have begun to resume their normal routines after a lockdown designed to curb the spread of the novel coronavirus was lifted despite the Russian capital still reporting more than 1000 daily cases.

item.title: HK protesters torn between hope and fear
item.description: Medical sector worker Tana has attended peaceful lunchtime rallies in Hong Kong regularly for months along with thousands of others protesting Beijing's influence and calling for greater democracy in the global financial hub.

item.title: Tonnes of cocaine found in cans in Poland
item.description: More than three tonnes of pure cocaine has been found hidden in 144 containers of frozen pineapple pulp in Poland.

item.title: German exports plunged 24% in April
item.description: German exports and imports slumped in April, posting their biggest declines since records began in 1990 as demand dried up in the coronavirus lockdown, casting further gloom over the outlook for Europe's biggest economy.

item.title: Russian Arctic spill reaches large lake
item.description: Diesel fuel from a major spill in the Russian Arctic has reached the waters of a pristine lake that serves as the basin for a river flowing into the Arctic Ocean, a senior official says.

item.title: Building collapse in Karachi kills 13
item.description: Pakistani police say at least 13 people were killed when a building collapsed in the southern port city of Karachi.
